Required Documents & Others

Documents

1. 10th marksheet (and pass certificate. For CBSE both are same)
2. 12th marksheet.
3. 12th pass certificate.
4. Migration certificate.
5. Medical form (which is available online for printout)
6. DD of a required amount (for hostel fee, mess fee, etc.)
7. And photocopy of each of these. 8.Besides these you are provided a form on campus asking if you prefer to freeze campus or not. That is also to be submitted.

Anti-ragging affidavit

1. Go to www.antiragging.in (or) www.amanmovement.org
2. Fill the information online as per the requirement.
3. On successfli completion you will receive affidavits, both for Student and Parent, through e-mail.
4. While filling the information online, you may need the following information:
a) Director’s Name
(i.) First Name: Raghurama  
( ii.) Second Name: Gunaje
b) Phone Number: 0832 2580 105
c) Registration Number : Your ID number
d) Nearest Police Station : Verna, Goa

Others

As for other things to be brought:
At the beginning of the semester, the daily necessities are sold inside the common room of the hostel. You get the following items in the sale:

  • Mattress
  • Buckets and Mugs
  • Footmat
  • Lock and Key
  • Dustbin
  • And other related items

You can bring the following books if you want (Slides wolid be self sufficient though and the Library will have most of these books):
  • Inorganic Chemistry, JD Lee
  • Organic Chemistry, Solomons and Fryhle
  • Let Us C (won’t need it though, can be used as reference)

List of Books

Here’s a list of 1st year books that’ll be required:

BIO F110 BIOLOGY LABORATORY
Lab Manual for Biology Laboratory

BIO F111 GENERAL BIOLOGY
Eldon D. Enger, Frederick C. Ross and David B. Bailey, Concepts in Biology 14th Edition (BITS Pilani Custom Edition)

BITS F110 ENGINEERING GRAPHICS
Kulkarni D M and Others, Engineering Graphics with AutoCAD

BITS F111 THERMODYNAMICS
Claus Borgnakke, &Richard E. Sonntag, Fundamentals of Thermodynamics

BITS F112 TECHNICAL REPORT WRITING
Hewings, M. and Thaine C, Cambridge Academic English (Advanced) Student’s Book

CHEM F110 CHEMISTRY LABORATORY
Lab Manual for Chemistry Laboratory

CHEM F111 GENERAL CHEMISTRY
(i) Atkins P W & Paul Julio de, The Elements of Physical Chemistry
(ii) Solomons T.W Graham &Fryhle Craig B, Organic Chemistry
(iii) J. D. Lee, Concise Inorganic Chemistry

CS F111 COMPUTER PROGRAMMING
Hanly, Jeri R & E.B. Koffman, Problem Solving & Program Design in C

EEE F111 ELECTRICAL SCIENCES
Leonard S. Bobrow, Fundamentals of Electrical Engineering(BITS Pilani Edition)

MATH F111 MATHEMATICS I
George B. Thomas, Maurice D. Weir and Joel Hass, Thomas's Calculus
MATH F112 MATHEMATICS II
(i) Churchill, R V and James W, Complex Variables and Applications
(ii) Andrilli, S & Hecker D, Elementary Linear Algebra Elsevier

MATH F113 PROBABILITY AND STATISTICS
Sheldon Ross, A first course in Probability

ME F110 WORKSHOP PRACTICE
(i) Parashar, B S N & R K Mittal, Elements of Manufacturing Processes
Workshop Practice Manual

PHY F110 PHYSICS LABORATORY
Lab Manual for Chemistry Laboratory

Please note that you needn’t purchase these books before hand and bring to campus, you can buy them on campus from seniors, book stores or online.
Apart from these there is a set of reference books for each subject which are provided to you in the course handouts, when college begins.
